nodes.bodyText: I think if the solution is generalized then this message is not good anymore: "Subnets are in %d different AZ, but subnets in %d different AZs required."
In a generalized solution this message is not valid any more. I would suggest "Insufficient number of subnets: at least %d subnets required"
I think this should be based on the AWS db deploy config. As I know currently we are using non multi AZ deployments in local mode so probably we dont need 2 subnet.
we won't address it in this pr
Can you please validate that we choose 2 subnet in different az ?
I think it shoulf be great to check the error message as well.
this should be depend on the deployment config
we won't address it in this pr
we don't want to add public subnet if we can avoid it
I would rename it to testMultiplePrivateSubnetTwoDifferentAz
